articles.description: Welcome to the website. I hope you enjoy it!

            About
            I am a PhD candidate studying Marine Science at the University of California, Santa Barbara. Working with Mark Brzezinski and Kimberlee Thamatrakoln to relate community biogeochemistry and phytoplankon physiology to ’Omics measurements primarily along the California coast.
            
            
            Research interests
            Microbial Ecology | Bioinformatics | Molecular Biology  Data Science | R | Reproducibility  Marine Science | Science Education | Biogeochemistry

articles.title: List of publications
articles.contents:
Maniscalco M, Brzezinski MA, McNair ,HM, Krause JW, Thamatrakoln K. Physiological interactions between nitrogen limitation and cooccurring silicon limitation within a Monterey Bay diatom bloom. In prep.
Maniscalco M, Brzezinski MA, Lampe RH, Cohen NR, McNair ,HM, Ellis KA, Brown M, Till CP, Twining BS, Bruland KW, Marchetti A, Thamatrakoln K. Diminished carbon and nitrate assimilation drives changes in Si stoichiometry in an iron-limited diatom assemblage. In review.
Ladd TM, Catlett D, Maniscalco M, Kim SM, Kelly RL, John SG, Carlson CA, Iglesias-Rodríguez MD. Wildfire ash deposition fertilizes coastal marine ecosystems. In review.
Kranzler CF, Brzezinski MA, Cohen NR, Lampe RH, Maniscalco M, Till CP, Mack J, Latham JR, Bruland KW, Twining BS, Marchetti A, Thamatrakoln K. Impaired viral infection and reduced mortality of diatoms in iron-limited oceanic regions. Nature Geoscience. 14: 231–237. doi:10.1038/s41561-021-00711-6
Krause JW, Brzezinski MA, Largier JL, McNair HM, Maniscalco M, Bidle KD, Allen AE, and Thamatrakoln K. 2020. The interaction of physical and biological factors drives phytoplankton spatial distribution in the northern California Current. Limnology and Oceanography. 65: 1974–1989. doi:10.1002/lno.11431
Kranzler CF, Krause JW, Brzezinski MA, Edwards BR, Biggs WP, Maniscalco M, McCrow JP, Van Mooy BAS, Bidle KD, Allen AE, Thamatrakoln K. 2021. Silicon limitation facilitates virus infection and mortality of marine diatoms. Nature Microbiology. 4: 1790–1797. doi:10.1038/s41564-019-0502-x
Maniscalco M, Nannen J, Sodi V, Silver G, Lowrey PL and Bidle KA. 2014. Light-dependent expression of four cryptic archaeal circadian gene homologs. Frontiers in Microbiology. 5:79. doi: 10.3389/fmicb.2014.00079

articles.title: Stearns Wharf Harmful Algal Bloom Blog
articles.description: Weekly updates about harmful algal bloom (HAB) monitoring from Stearns Wharf as part of the Southern California Ocean Observing System (SCCOOS)
